intro: Niphobolus schimperianus, commonly known as the Schimper's niphobolus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
